questiontext.text:
Exercise

The diagram below represents a heavy cable hanging under gravity from two points at the same height. Such a curve (shown as a dashed line), known as a catenary, is described by a mathematical function known as a hyperbolic cosine, \(f(x)=\cosh x\).

Figure: A catenary          


  1. Comment upon any symmetry: the function is [[1]].

  2. Is this function one-to-one or many-to-one?: [[2]]

  3. Is this a continuous or discontinuous function?: [[3]]

  4. State \(\lim_{x\rightarrow 0} \cosh x\): [[4]]
